meta.description: Configuration file for MCP server accessibility analysis of React and Next.js applications

accessibilityRules.title: Images Must Have Alt Text
accessibilityRules.intent: Ensure all images are accessible to screen readers.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Always provide meaningful alt text. Use alt="" for decorative images.
accessibilityRules.remediationExplanation: Add appropriate alt attributes to all image elements.
examplesOfExploits: Screen readers cannot interpret images without alt text, leading to a poor user experience for visually impaired users.
relatedVulnerabilities: Accessibility violations can lead to legal repercussions under laws such as the ADA.
accessibilityRules.detectionLimitations: May not detect dynamically added images without alt text.
accessibilityRules.additionalNotes: Consider using tools like axe or Lighthouse for comprehensive accessibility audits.

accessibilityRules.title: Interactive Elements Must Be Keyboard Accessible
accessibilityRules.intent: Ensure clickable elements are accessible via keyboard.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Use semantic <button> elements or add keyboard handlers.
accessibilityRules.remediationExplanation: Replace non-semantic clickable elements with <button> or add keyboard event handlers.
examplesOfExploits: Users relying on keyboard navigation may be unable to interact with non-accessible clickable elements.
relatedVulnerabilities: Accessibility violations can lead to legal repercussions under laws such as the ADA.
accessibilityRules.detectionLimitations: May not detect all custom interactive elements.
accessibilityRules.additionalNotes: Consider using tools like axe or Lighthouse for comprehensive accessibility audits.

accessibilityRules.title: ARIA Roles Must Have Required Attributes
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Follow ARIA Authoring Practices for required attributes.
accessibilityRules.remediationExplanation: Add required ARIA attributes to elements with ARIA roles.
examplesOfExploits: Screen readers may misinterpret elements with incomplete ARIA roles, leading to confusion.
relatedVulnerabilities: Accessibility violations can lead to legal repercussions under laws such as the ADA.
accessibilityRules.detectionLimitations: May not cover all ARIA roles and their required attributes.
accessibilityRules.additionalNotes: Refer to the ARIA specification for comprehensive role and attribute mappings.

accessibilityRules.title: Form Inputs Must Have Labels
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Use <label> elements or ARIA attributes to associate labels with inputs.
accessibilityRules.remediationExplanation: Add labels to all form inputs using <label> or ARIA attributes.
examplesOfExploits: Users of assistive technologies may struggle to understand the purpose of unlabeled form fields.
relatedVulnerabilities: Accessibility violations can lead to legal repercussions under laws such as the ADA.
accessibilityRules.detectionLimitations: May not detect dynamically generated form fields.
accessibilityRules.additionalNotes: Consider using tools like axe or Lighthouse for comprehensive accessibility audits.

accessibilityRules.title: Correct Heading Hierarchy
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Use headings in a nested manner without skipping levels.
accessibilityRules.remediationExplanation: Adjust heading levels to follow a logical order without skipping levels.
examplesOfExploits: Improper heading structure can confuse users of assistive technologies, making navigation difficult.
relatedVulnerabilities: Accessibility violations can lead to legal repercussions under laws such as the ADA.
accessibilityRules.detectionLimitations: May not account for dynamically generated headings.
accessibilityRules.additionalNotes: Refer to best practices for document structure and heading usage.

accessibilityRules.title: Visible Focus Indicator
accessibilityRules.intent: Ensure keyboard users can see focus.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Do not remove focus indicators; customize them if necessary.
accessibilityRules.remediationExplanation: Ensure focus indicators are visible and distinct for keyboard navigation.
examplesOfExploits: Users relying on keyboard navigation may lose track of their position without visible focus indicators.
relatedVulnerabilities: Accessibility violations can lead to legal repercussions under laws such as the ADA.
accessibilityRules.detectionLimitations: May not detect custom focus styles that are not fully removed.
accessibilityRules.additionalNotes: Consider using tools like axe or Lighthouse for comprehensive accessibility audits.

accessibilityRules.title: No Focusable Elements Inside aria-hidden
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Avoid placing focusable elements inside aria-hidden containers.
accessibilityRules.remediationExplanation: Remove focusable elements from within aria-hidden containers.
examplesOfExploits: Screen readers may still access focusable elements within aria-hidden containers, causing confusion.
relatedVulnerabilities: Accessibility violations can lead to legal repercussions under laws such as the ADA.
accessibilityRules.detectionLimitations: May not detect dynamically added focusable elements.
accessibilityRules.additionalNotes: Refer to ARIA best practices for managing hidden content.

accessibilityRules.title: Page Must Have Accessible Title
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Provide a unique and descriptive title for each page.
accessibilityRules.remediationExplanation: Add a descriptive title element to each page.
examplesOfExploits: Users may have difficulty identifying pages in browser tabs or bookmarks without descriptive titles.
relatedVulnerabilities: Accessibility violations can lead to legal repercussions under laws such as the ADA.
accessibilityRules.detectionLimitations: May not detect titles set dynamically via JavaScript.
accessibilityRules.additionalNotes: Consider using tools like axe or Lighthouse for comprehensive accessibility audits.
